pr_title: interop-testing: use server hostname instead of id for xds test

timeline.message: interop-testing: use server hostname instead of id for xds test

timeline.bodyText: You might need use a generated random hostname as a fallback hostname in XdsTestServer.  As in e7d7c5b#diff-2140bcb433e6510183658de7492bfb57R58
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: I think it's WAI as-is: the test driver script will need to assert on the hostnames recorded by the client, and so a randomly generated host won't be useful - if hostname is missing, the test will (and should) be failed.
replies.author: ericgribkoff

replies.bodyText: If the hostname is missing, how will test fail? Is it easy to debug then?
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: The test spec is still in progress, but a sample scenario is something like: there are four backends, and we expect the client to round-robin over all four. If one of the hostnames is missing, the test will see that it is round-robining over three backends and fail.
replies.author: ericgribkoff

replies.bodyText: Good point about debugging. Modified server to throw (fail) if it can't get hostname.
replies.author: ericgribkoff

timeline.message: throw if server cannot get host

timeline.bodyText: host can be final now.  But not a big deal.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0
